title: @RiotLyte Don't punish me for being toxic. Reform me to someone that's not.

embed.description: The player behavior team at Riot uses science to understand toxic player behavior. During this session, Jeffrey "Dr. Lyte" Lin discusses what Riot's statisticians, scientists, and developers are doing with the latest research in behavioral, social, and cognitive psychology to solve one of the biggest problems in online gaming today.

body:
You're not solving the problem you're just providing a temporary 'solution.'

Don't focus on me being toxic, focus on why I'm toxic in the first place. Did I have a bad day? Did my teammate feed/afk? What's causing me to be toxic in those games? How can I be someone that's not toxic?
